result.execSummary:
All charges against Devon Lee Coleman in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Devon Lee Coleman is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devon Lee Coleman

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devon Lee Coleman in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Devon Lee Coleman.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Matter set for motion hearing.  On motion of the state, Court ordered case dismissed.
to Suppress and Brief in Support of Motion to Suppress, fled.  rmm

Defendant Devon Lee Coleman in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom. Status conference held. Attorney Obscherning requests a briefing schedule and motion hearing date. Court orders defense to file motion and brief with the court no later than 8/26/2022: State to file response no later than 9/16/2022. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Devon Lee Coleman in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Obscherning has not received discovery or an offer and requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Devon Lee Coleman in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Defendant Devon Lee Coleman in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Devon Lee Coleman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. This hearing may be streamed live at the Court's discretion on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
